TopicTitle: Look what just spoiled my rover trip...

Articles.Content: Happens all the time. Since the Mun has zero orbital inclination in regards to Kerbin and the Sun eclipses are incredibly common.

Common but FABULOUS ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

I still remember the first time I saw an eclipse in KSP. It was magnificent and beautiful, and still just looks effing awesome, don't you agree?

> 
> Common but FABULOUS ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)
> I still remember the first time I saw an eclipse in KSP. It was magnificent and beautiful, and still just looks effing awesome, don't you agree?

Can't wait until they give us dynamic shadows that cross SOIs.
You think this is bad? Just wait till you lose an unmanned probe about to land on Mun and lose power 500m from surface because of "unexpected" Kerbin eclipse...

I got this beauty in LKO

![vBaDPUz.png](http://i.imgur.com/vBaDPUz.png)

![2DYFzCu.png](http://i.imgur.com/2DYFzCu.png)

(Used: Texture Replacer (Rareden's Skybox), and planetshine.
Oh noes! The Kraken! Quick, call Scott Manley!

An eclipse isn't merely Mun getting in the way of Kerbol. It's actually the Eye of the Almighty Kraken gazing down on you. Thus, eclipses are the best times to go visit the Monoliths, and are also auspicious omens for starting long voyages. They are a sign of the Kraken's favor.

[![17366436714_4595685a91_z.jpg](https://c1.staticflickr.com/9/8879/17366436714_4595685a91_z.jpg)](https://flic.kr/p/ssBwAE)

Didn't there used to be an eclipse calculator?

Let me tell you about the worst eclipse that I've experienced.

I was descending upon Minmus when Kerbin eclipsed the sun. I lost power for SAS and RCS, and descended to my doom. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
And this, is why you use RTGs instead of Solar Panels. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Plus, Gigantor in Laythe orbit with 100% exposure = 0.92 EC/sec

You can always pack more batteries! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

More power storage means more time without needing a recharge. 

With the new service bays I've managed to cram around five or six of the starter battery packs into one space.
Never had this happen to me before. Might be cause I always pack a 1000 energy battery on everything I build. That and I don't really drive around Kerbin much.
